medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe bronchoconstriction following inhalation of short-acting b2-agonists.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 41-year-old farmer with a 40-pack-year smoking history, experienced asthma symptoms for 3 years. Two weeks prior to admission, he had an asthma exacerbation and increased the use of formoterol. Before admission, he felt breathless and inhaled two puffs of formoterol followed by several puffs of salbutamol, resulting in acute respiratory distress within minutes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic asthma; treated with methylprednisolone and formoterol.
medical_history.social_history: 40-pack-year smoking history; occupation as a farmer.
